New Records: Luke Raley hit his 17th home run of the season during the game.
Caden Dana earned his first win of the season.
Ben Joyce recorded his 4th save of the season.
Key Match Events: Luke Raley hit a solo home run in the top of the 2nd inning to give the Mariners an early 1-0 lead.
J.P. Crawford grounded into a double play to end the 9th inning, preserving the Angels' win.
The game remained tied 2-2 heading into the bottom of the 9th inning before the Angels scored the winning runs.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mariners and Angels both entered the game with identical 2-3 records entering the series.
The starting lineups featured several key players for both teams.
Post-Match Reflections: Seattle Mariners manager Dan Wilson called the victory a 'pivotal moment' in their playoff push.
The game marked a crucial win for the Mariners as they looked to secure a playoff spot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game started at 1:07 p.m. local time and lasted 2 hours and 36 minutes.
The attendance for the game was 39,370 fans.
Others: The game was played at Angel Stadium of Anaheim with a grass surface.
The win probability chart showed the Mariners' chances fluctuating throughout the game.
